name: The Feeling
description:
'''The Feeling''' are an English [[rock music|rock]]/[[pop music|pop]] band from [[Horsham]], [[Sussex]].

Following a limited release of their first single "[[Fill My Little World]]" in late 2005, the band entered the [[UK Singles Chart]] at #7 with their first full release "[[Sewn (single)|Sewn]]" in February 2006. The single was one of the year's biggest radio hits, after being played first in the UK on the [[Dermot O'Leary]] Show on [[BBC Radio 2|Radio 2]], along with their first live radio session.

Their debut album ''[[Twelve Stops and Home]]'' was released in the UK on 5 June 2006 and on 27 February 2007 in the [[United States|US]]. Their second album, ''[[Join with Us (album)|Join with Us]]'', which reached number one on the [[UK Albums Chart]], was released on 18 February 2008.  Their third album, ''[[Together We Were Made]]'', was released on 20 June 2011, followed by the release of their greatest hits album ''[[Singles (2006â€“2011)]]'' on 5 December. Their fourth album ''[[Boy Cried Wolf]]'' was released in 2013. In March 2016 the band released their [[The Feeling (album)|self-titled 5th studio album]]. Their sixth studio album, ''Loss. Hope. Love.'', was released in May 2022. Their name comes from a neon sign seen by bassist Richard on a bar (Le Feeling) in Paris.
